intro: Senecio subalatipetiolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features linear, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the daisy family. Senecio subalatipetiolatus is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments.
